conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, rooms read as volumes, viewed from an elevated angled perspective with roof/ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and volumetric interior; proper angled view; cutaway is present and mostly clean, though rendering is somewhat soft/low-detail which reduces corner/edge clarity.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Major layout fidelity issues: the 2D plan includes a separate garage block on the right and a balcony at top-left; these are not represented. Internal partitioning and room arrangement do not clearly match the 2D adjacency and proportions (bedroom/bath/kitchen placements appear altered).

interior_elements.notes: Beds and dining tables are present, but kitchen/bath fixtures are not clearly or accurately defined relative to the 2D plan (kitchen/laundry/bath/WC elements appear missing or ambiguous). Furniture-room assignment is only partially consistent.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/windows are distinguishable and background is clean, but the image is hazy/low-contrast which reduces readability of openings and finer geometry; no obvious broken meshes.

detected_errors.description: Garage (separate block in 2D) is missing in the 3D model; balcony/cut-out area also not represented.
Internal room configuration and adjacency/proportions do not convincingly align with the 2D plan (kitchen/laundry/bath/WC zone placement appears substantially different).
Door/window placement and opening proportions cannot be matched reliably to the 2D plan; several openings appear generic rather than plan-faithful.
Kitchen and bathroom fixtures are missing/unclear compared to the 2D plan; furniture detail is insufficient to confirm room identities.
Soft/hazy rendering reduces structural clarity and makes verification of partitions/openings harder.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway conversion is present, but major plan-to-model mismatches (notably missing garage/balcony and altered internal layout) significantly reduce geometric fidelity.
